titlestmt.titleproper: Presbyterian Union of Binghamton, New York records 1890-1927
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Presbyterian Union of Binghamton, New York records

bioghist.p: The Presbyterian Union of Binghamton was founded in 1890. The purpose of the Union was to advance the cause of Christ by the planting and nurturing of Sabbath schools and churches, and by the promotion of mutual acquaintance, unity of feeling, and concert of action among the Presbyterian Churches in the city of Binghamton, New York.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of minutes of monthly and annual meetings of the Board of Trustees of the Presbyterian Union of Binghamton, New York. The minutes document the routine business of the board, including some financial information, election of officers, and reports from various committees. The volume includes summaries of addresses delivered at the group's annual meetings on topics largely related to the development of the church in Binghamton. The minutes also include the Union's constitution, by-laws, and articles of incorporation.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
